intro: Cryptantha cinerea var. arenicola, commonly known as the sandflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. The species is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and drought tolerance.
